overview:
Mike has ten years experience in management consulting to medical device, pharmaceutical, health care providers and payors. He has a decade of experience in enterprise software, social media, and eCommerce as well as financial services. In his role as Managing Partner of No World Borders, Mike oversees several practices with a focus on the health care market. He has in-depth experience with revenue cycle management, meaningful use and electronic health records, and the impact of ICD-10 on payors and providers from a people, process, financial and IT perspective. He is a regular speaker, and was recently quoted in the Wall Street Journal Venture Capital Dispatch regarding venture-backed information-technology companies that serve hospitals and health insurers, to deal with “Y2K” problems such as ICD 10. He was been quoted in the Wall Street Journal Health Blog. He watches emerging trends in Accountable Care Organizations and incentive programs for Medicare Advantage health plans. He is an expert in participatory social media for building brands and crowd sourcing solutions. Mike founded No World Borders and secured its first clients including Abbott Medical Optics, Regence Blue Cross Blue Shield, and other health care companies.

His experience with other pioneering companies has contributed directly No World Bordersâ€™ success. At Fidelity and First American, Mike led innovative eCommerce and consulting business groups that were instrumental in transforming both companiesâ€™ strategy from a siloed services to integrated exchanges using software as a service (SaaS) platforms. His team served large financial services firms such as JP Morgan and Wells Fargo, enabling a 100% increase in revenue in new markets. Prior to that, he was CEO of Erogo (acquired by Citrix) an SaaS billing company. While there, revenue increased over 400 percent and the customer base doubled. He led the development of the asset acquisition strategy and launch of LeadersOnline, a Heidrick & Struggles backed early social media venture and assisted in the IPO of Heidrick. LeadersOnline added over $100 million to the market cap of Heidrick at the time of their IPO according to Goldman Sachs. Prior to that, Mike served as vice president of marketing and channel sales for Digitalk (acquired by ParcPlace and Cincom), the leader in enterprise object development. He led a transformation from a packaged tool to enterprise software sales. Revenue grew 300 percent, and the company was acquired for ten times the value of the revenue when he started three years earlier. He served over 10 years in executive, strategy, sales and marketing, and product management positions at Borland, Hewlett Packard, Symantec, and Oracle.

He is a lecturer regarding business and technology issues at industry events, the University of California Irvine, and Loyola University where he served as adjunct professor. He earned his degree in Business Administration from the Entrepreneur Program at University of Southern California (USC), studied computer science and economics at the University of California, Irvine (UCI) and attended the University of Pennsylvaniaâ€™s Wharton School executive management program. Mr. Arrigo is certified in Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma methodologies, and is a member of the Workgroup for Electronic Data Interchange (WEDI) for health care information and a contributing author to health care industry whitepapers. He is an advanced youth soccer coach and an avid road cyclist. In October 2007 Mr. Arrigo competed in the U.S. Olympic Sailing Team Trials.
